simple.xml.load
Class LabelFactory

java.lang.Object
  simple.xml.load.LabelFactory

final class LabelFactory
extends java.lang.Object

The LabelFactory object is used to create instances of the Label object that can be used to convert a DOM node into a Java object. Each label created requires the field it represents and the XML annotation it is marked with.

The Label objects created by this factory a selected using the XML annotation type. If the annotation type is not known the factory will throw an exception, otherwise a label instance is created that will expose the properties of the annotation.

Author:
Niall Gallagher

          The Entry object is used to create a constructor that can be used to instantiate the correct label for the XML annotation specified.

Constructor Detail

LabelFactory

LabelFactory()
Method Detail

getInstance

public static Label getInstance(java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                                java.lang.annotation.Annotation label)
Creates a Label using the provided field and XML annotation. The label produced contains all information related to an object member. It knows the name of the XML entity, as well as whether it is required. Once created the converter can transform a DOM node into Java object and vice versa.

Parameters:
field - this is the field that the label is produced for
label - represents the XML annotation for the field
Returns:
returns the label instantiated for the field

getConstructor

private static java.lang.reflect.Constructor getConstructor(java.lang.annotation.Annotation label)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a constructor that can be used to instantiate the label used to represent the specified annotation. The constructor created by this method takes two arguments, a field object and an Annotation of the type specified.

Parameters:
label - the XML annotation representing the label
Returns:
returns a constructor for instantiating the label
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if the annotation is not supported

getEntry

private static LabelFactory.Entry getEntry(java.lang.annotation.Annotation label)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Creates an entry that is used to select the constructor for the label. Each label must implement a constructor that takes a field and the specific XML annotation for that field. If the annotation is not know this method throws an exception.

Parameters:
label - the XML annotation used to create the label
Returns:
this returns the entry used to create a suitable constructor for the label
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if the annotation is not supported
